ITEM.name: Getting Started with State Dialog Commands
ITEM.text: is a first simple but complete example of a state dialog command

ITEM.name: How to Describe State Dialog Commands Using UML
ITEM.text: is the tools that UML provides to design your state dialog commands.

ITEM.name: How to Create a State Dialog Command
ITEM.text: describes how to create the dialog command class.

ITEM.name: How to Manage the State Dialog Command Lifecycle
ITEM.text: describes how to code the command class constructor and destructor, and the methods Activate, Desactivate, and Cancel

ITEM.name: How to Implement the Command Statechart Diagram
ITEM.text: describes how to code the command class BuildGraph method that contains the command state chart implementation.

ITEM.name: How to Assign Resources to a State Dialog Command
ITEM.text: describes how to refer to external resources for the command prompts.

ITEM.name: Implementing the Statechart Diagram
ITEM.text: is a use case that is intended to show how to implement the statechart diagram by coding the command BuildGraph method.

ITEM.name: How to Use a Dialog Box as Input
Associating a Dialog Box with a Dialog Agent - Part 1
Associating a Dialog Box with a Dialog Agent - Part 2
Associating a Dialog Box with a State
Subscribing to Mouse Move Events
ITEM.text: is a use case that is intended to show how to subscribe to mouse move events.

ITEM.name: Managing Undo/Redo of Input and Actions
Creating Contextual Menus in a State Dialog Command
Creating a Command that Consists in a Dialog Box
ITEM.text: is a use case that is intended to show how to use a dialog box as a standalone command without states.

ITEM.name: Editing Objects During a Command
ITEM.text: is a use case that is intended to show you how to use the CATEditAgent class to stack a workbench during a state command in order to edit an object.
